availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Lindsey (Versailles, Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Versailles, Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas N. Lindsey and Isabella P. Lindsey. Married Hellen Maria Talbot Lindsey in Franklin County, Kentucky on January 18, 1859. Attended Kentucky Military Institute. Resident in Franklin County, Kentucky in 1850. Moved to Texas in 1856. Farmer in Versailles, Kentucky in 1860. Enrolled for military duty in Seventh District of Woodford County, Kentucky on July 1, 1863 (U.S.A). Assisted in organizing Kentucky state militia between May 1864 and October 1864. Assistant pay master for the State of Kentucky in December 1864.
